item.title: Renewable Energy and Energy Conservation Tax Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 615, H.R. 2776 is laid on the table.

item.title: Housing and Economic Recovery Act of 2008

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 191 (Roll no. 826). (text: CR H9715)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 191 (Roll no. 826).(text: CR H9715)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 186 (Roll no. 825). (consideration: CR H9721-9722)
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on H. Res. 615.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 615.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H9715-9718, H9719-9722)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 106.

All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI. The amendment printed in part A of the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution shall be considered as adopted in the House and the Committee of the Whole.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-300, by Mr. Welch (VT).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-300, by Mr. Welch (VT).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3221) moving the United States toward greater energy independence and security, developing innovative new technologies, reducing carbon emissions, creating green jobs, protecting consumers, increasing clean renewable energy production, and modernizing our energy infrastructure, and for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2776) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax incentives for the production of renewable energy and energy conservation.

Sets forth the rule for consideration of: (1) H.R. 3221 (New Direction for Energy Independence, National Security, and Consumer Protection Act); and (2) H.R. 2776 (Renewable Energy and Energy Conservation Tax Act of 2007).

Sets forth the rule for consideration of: (1) H.R. 3221 (New Direction for Energy Independence, National Security, and Consumer Protection Act); and (2) H.R. 2776 (Renewable Energy and Energy Conservation Tax Act of 2007).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
